thinking.disposable_income: Mid-West has a moderate median household income around $55,000, with about 20% of residents living below poverty level, indicating varied but generally constrained disposable income levels.
thinking.discretionary_consumption: The area has moderate discretionary spending capacity, with many residents being cost-sensitive to additional taxes and fees given the mixed-income nature of the neighborhood.
thinking.accessibility: The neighborhood has good road access via Westheimer Road and Gessner Road, moderate bus service, but limited rail transit access, with most residents relying on personal vehicles for transportation.
thinking.decision_rationale: 1) Prioritized policies with lower sales tax (0.5-1.0%) to protect discretionary spending 2) Favored moderate driving fees ($0.50) to improve transit without excessive burden on drivers 3) Selected lower transit fares ($0.75-$1.25) to keep transit affordable 4) Balanced travel time improvements with cost impacts 5) Considered the area's car-dependent nature while supporting transit improvements
